comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://m.webtoons.com/en/romance/be-my-villain/list?title_no=2728](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.webtoons.com%2Fen%2Fromance%2Fbe-my-villain%2Flist%3Ftitle_no%3D2728) ### Comment > So for some reason all of a sudden last night Webtoon started getting ads again. There was an ad at the end of each comic, and the New & Hot reappeared again. I didn't change any settings in AdGuard. I was only using the general AdGuard block list before. No other site/app had ads, just Webtoon. Somehow they circumvented ad blocking. I added a handful of new lists to AdGuard including Peter Lowe's, etc., and that helped with the ad at the end of the comic, but there is still the annoying New & Hot as well as pop ups like "buy our coins!!" I'm not sure what happened but the app is way more annoying to use now. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/qaxswspnjo0cs4w80kc00ckwcgss8coam2e56quymw.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS DNS setup: | Device or router settings DNS server: | Private AdGuard DNS server System version: | `Android 15` Browser: | It's the app Blocklists: | General:
AdGuard DNS,
Peter Lowe's Blocklist,
OISD Blocklist Small,
Dan Pollock's List

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.alltrails.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.alltrails.com%2F) ### Comment > **Steps to reproduce:** > 1. Enable AdGuard in browser (reproducible in both Firefox and Safari) > 2. Attempt to login **using Google** to alltrails.com > > **Expected result:** > AllTrails website is logged in, using the chosen Google account. > > **Actual result:** > AllTrails website is _not_ logged in. Developer console (Firefox) shows this CORS error: > > > Cross-Origin Request Blocked: The Same Origin Policy disallows reading the remote resource at https://play.google.com/log?format=json&hasfast=true&authuser=0. labels.name: A: Problematic

issue.body:
### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Chrome, Edge или другой браузер на основе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)

> app is not blocking ads on any site with everything I need enabled, fix your app before I switch.

You should check what certificata the browser did use. If it's not AdGuard, then the websites load as it is. In that case, you can try to reinstall it via the settings or contact support@adguard.com.

comment.body:
Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью AdGuard Extra.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

* [Установка на браузеры Chrome, Edge или другие, основанные на Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установка на Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

Seems that is an ad link, so I've removed the rules. However, you can add these ones to user rules.
```
@@||tyserving.com/*?source=*&work=*
@@/redirect?target=*
```

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
In on eof the very first ones they (Hamburg I think) adblockers are legal, but website owner can set up such paywall and not legal to circumvent.

The current one can rule we are not allowed to modify anything on their site which would result in removing all rules for the site.

Imho all those court decisions regarding bild.de are not rational and the court does not have much knowledge of KT in general.

comment.body: Is there some other court case regarding paywalls that I'm not aware of?

issue.title: Fix #88593 www.bild.de

comment.body:
@BlazDT I don't believe the court case with Axel Springer SE and Eyeo has anything to do specifically with paywalls. They are trying to claim that the content in the DOM and CSS still counts as protected code; as such, anything that modifies them would violate the German Copyright Act. That would mean many of the current rules are already breaking that argument; just because AdGuard gets detected does not exclude it.

Note: The court case regarding that is still pending.

comment.body:
Why maximize the map? The goal for us is "site's original layout minus ads", don't go anything further. Since such miximazation is not intended by the site, now its layout is broken:
Screenshot
> However, it seems that height of the map container cannot be increased easily because of HTMLTableElement. I don't know what you're talking about. What we have to address is the big placeholder on the bottom, which is clearly caused by the hard-coded `2048` px height of the tr.

comment.body:
Fixed in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/14f649e6a4f1d3977ce3cf1739d2b335e5242e85 but filters update will be available in 1-2 hours.
Until then, you can add following rules to user rules:
```adblock
||alicdn.com^$badfilter
||aliexpress-media.com^$badfilter
```
